title: How to Do an Evil Glare

steps.title: By definition, a glare involves direct and continuous eye contact.
steps.content: By definition, a glare involves direct and continuous eye contact. No evil glare would be complete without it. [1] X Research source To perfect the effect, picture an object from a vivid memory. Fixate on it in your mindâ€™s eye without blinking, allowing the memory to fuel your intensity. People usually begin to feel uneasy when they notice that someone has been staring at them for at least ten seconds. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Engaging your eyebrows helps exaggerate your look.
steps.content: Engaging your eyebrows helps exaggerate your look. Pull your eyebrows down and together slightly as you glare. The more exaggerated this is, the angrier you will look. [3] X Research source Reader Poll: We asked 1854 wikiHow readers who read body language, and only 9% of them agreed that the best sign of anger is furrowed eyebrows. [Take Poll] However, when accompanied by other physical reactions like flaring your nostrils, this can help signal aggression.

steps.title: You may find that your eyes naturally squint when your pull your eyebrows down.
steps.content: You may find that your eyes naturally squint when your pull your eyebrows down. If you don't think your squint is visible enough, do it consciously, as a squint has long been associated with the "evil eye." [4] X Research source Squinting too much will make you look like you're trying to read a sign from far away, so keep it subtle.

steps.title: This is a subtle gesture that others will interpret as a sign of aggression and anger.
steps.content: This is a subtle gesture that others will interpret as a sign of aggression and anger. This might look strange if you overdo it, so you shouldn't be craning your neck or looking up at the ceiling.

steps.title: The snarl is a very clear nonverbal sign of anger.
steps.content: The snarl is a very clear nonverbal sign of anger. In order to achieve this look, pull your lips together to make them look thinner, and pull both your mouth and your cheekbones up slightly. [5] X Research source Be sure to pull your entire mouth up. Pulling just the corners up will read as a smile, which is not desirable in this case, unless you want the person you are glaring at to know that you are just being playful.

steps.title: People often flare their nostrils when they are angry.
steps.content: People often flare their nostrils when they are angry. If you are able to do this consciously, it will definitely enhance the evil look of your glare. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Try making all of these adjustments to your facial expression at once.
steps.content: Try making all of these adjustments to your facial expression at once. Depending on the exact kind of evil you're going for, you may want to experiment with using all of these facial expressions or just a few. Research has found that when a face displays just one of the characteristics of an "angry face," it is interpreted as strong and assertive, but not angry. [7] X Research source If you want to look assertive and maybe even menacing, but not necessarily angry, try incorporating just one or two of the adjustments into your facial expression. Practice your expression in front of a mirror to determine which level of anger is appropriate for your needs.

steps.title: Research has found that red clothing makes people look more aggressive.
steps.content: Research has found that red clothing makes people look more aggressive. [8] X Research source Use this to your advantage by incorporating a few red details into your outfit for a subtle assertiveness, or by wearing an entirely red outfit if you want to look super angry and evil.

steps.title: Use heavy eye makeup and contour your cheeks to enhance your look.
steps.content: Use heavy eye makeup and contour your cheeks to enhance your look. To get an evil look, take a cue from some of your favorite television and movie villains. It's easy to get a beautiful yet menacing look with some simple makeup tricks. A black and gold smokey eye with cat eye liner is perfect. To get this look, apply gold shadow to your lids and black shadow to your creases, blending the two together. Then line your upper lid with black liquid eye liner. Use gold eyeliner above your black eyeliner, around the inner corner of your eye, and under your lower lash line. Make sure all of your eye shadow and liner extends beyond the external corner of your eyelid into a wing for the perfect cat eyed look. A matte red lip is the perfect complement to your evil smokey eye. Apply blush to your cheekbones and a darker contouring color under your cheekbones.

steps.title: The shape of your eyebrows can dramatically change your facial expression.
steps.content: The shape of your eyebrows can dramatically change your facial expression. It's actually very easy to tweak their shape. If you want a slightly angrier, more aggressive look, try using an eyebrow pencil to exaggerate your arches. You should aim for a subtle point at the highest part of your brow. [9] X Research source Be careful not to overdo your arch to the point that your eyebrows look fake.

steps.title: People interpret good posture as a sign of confidence.
steps.content: People interpret good posture as a sign of confidence. You definitely want to appear confident while executing your evil glare, so be sure to stand (or sit) with your shoulders back and your head held high. [10] X Research source Think about how much impact your evil glare will lose if you don't look confident while doing it! Your facial expressions will all be for naught if you don't have the confident body language to back them up.
